VRDisplayCapabilities.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The VRDisplayCapabilities interface of the WebVR API describes the capabilities of a â€” its features can be used to perform VR device capability tests, for example can it return position information.

blockquote.para: This interface was part of the old WebVR API. It has been superseded by the WebXR Device API.

remarks.para: This interface is accessible through the property.

VRDisplayCapabilitiesCanPresent.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The canPresent read-only property of the interface returns a boolean value stating whether the VR display is capable of presenting content (e.g., through an HMD).

blockquote.para: This property was part of the old WebVR API. It has been superseded by the WebXR Device API.

remarks.para: This is useful for identifying "magic window" devices that are capable of 6DoF tracking but for which is not meaningful. If canPresent is false, calls to will fail, and will return null.

summary.blockquote: NOTEThis property was part of the old WebVR API. It has been superseded by the WebXR Device API.

remarks.para: The hasExternalDisplay read-only property of the interface returns true if the VR display is separate from the device's primary display.

blockquote.para: If presenting VR content would obscure other content on the device, this will return false, in which case the application should not attempt to mirror VR content or update non-VR UI because that content will not be visible.

VRDisplayCapabilitiesHasOrientation.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The hasOrientation read-only property of the interface returns true if the VR display can track and return orientation information.

blockquote.para: This property was part of the old WebVR API. It has been superseded by the WebXR Device API.

VRDisplayCapabilitiesHasPosition.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The hasPosition read-only property of the interface returns true if the VR display can track and return position information.

blockquote.para: This property was part of the old WebVR API. It has been superseded by the WebXR Device API.

VRDisplayCapabilitiesMaxLayers.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The maxLayers read-only property of the interface returns a number indicating the maximum number of s that the VR display can present at once (e.g., the maximum length of the array that can accept.)

blockquote.para: This property was part of the old WebVR API. It has been superseded by the WebXR Device API.

VRDisplayCapabilitiesMaxLayers.value: A number, which must be 1 if is true, or 0 otherwise.
